questions.text:
Study the following information: Eight friends A, B, C, D, E, F, G, and H are sitting around a circular table facing the center. A sits third to the left of C. Only one person sits between A and G. E sits second to the right of G. F is an immediate neighbor of E. Only one person sits between F and B. H sits second to the left of B. 

Who sits to the immediate right of H?
questions.solution: Arrangement (Clockwise from A): A, F, E, B, C, H, G, D. H sits between C and G. Immediate right of H is G.

questions.text: Based on the circular arrangement in Q1: How many people sit between C and E when counted from the left of C?
questions.solution: Counting left from C: B, E. Two people sit between them.

questions.text: Based on the circular arrangement in Q1: Who sits opposite to F?
questions.solution: Opposite to F is H.

questions.text: Based on the circular arrangement in Q1: Which of the following statements is TRUE?
options: B sits immediate left of E
Only two people sit between G and F
C is an immediate neighbor of B
questions.solution: C is to the immediate left of B. So 'C is an immediate neighbor of B' is true.

questions.text: Based on the circular arrangement in Q1: Find the odd one out.
questions.solution: In AE, BC, HG, and EB, the distance is either immediate or 1 gap. However, D and F are sitting opposite to each other. DF is the odd one.

questions.text:
Study the following information: Seven persons P, Q, R, S, T, U, and V live on 7 different floors. The bottommost floor is 1 and top is 7. V lives on an odd numbered floor but not on floor 3. Only two persons live between V and S. P lives immediately below S. Q lives on an even numbered floor immediately above U. R lives above T.

Who lives on the topmost floor?
questions.solution: Arrangement: 7-Q, 6-U, 5-V, 4-R, 3-T, 2-S, 1-P. Q lives on floor 7.

questions.text: Based on the floor puzzle in Q6: How many people live between U and T?
questions.solution: U is on 6, T is on 3. Between them are floors 5 and 4 (V and R). So, Two.

questions.text: Based on the floor puzzle in Q6: Who lives immediately above V?
questions.solution: V is on 5. U is on 6. So U lives immediately above V.

questions.text: Based on the floor puzzle in Q6: Which of the following combinations is correct?
questions.solution: Floor 3 is occupied by T. This is correct.

questions.text: Based on the floor puzzle in Q6: If all persons are arranged alphabetically from top to bottom, how many remain in same position?
questions.solution: Original: Q, U, V, R, T, S, P. Alphabetical: P, Q, R, S, T, U, V. Only T remains at the same position (5th form top/floor 3).

questions.text:
Study the following information: Eight people J, K, L, M, N, O, P, Q are sitting in a linear row facing North. J sits second from one of the extreme ends. Only three people sit between J and O. L sits second to the right of O. L is an immediate neighbor of K and N. K is not an neighbor of O. P sits to the immediate right of J. M sits at one of the ends.

Who sits at the extreme right end?
questions.solution: Arrangement: M, J, P, O, Q, N, L, K. Right end is K.

questions.text: Based on the linear row in Q11: How many persons sit to the left of Q?
questions.solution: Q is at 5th position from left. So 4 people (M, J, P, O) sit to the left.

questions.text: Based on the linear row in Q11: Who sits exactly between P and N?
questions.solution: Between P and N are O and Q.

questions.text: Based on the linear row in Q11: What is the position of M with respect to O?
questions.solution: O is 4th from left. M is 1st. M is third to the left of O.

questions.text: Based on the linear row in Q11: Which pair consists of immediate neighbors?
questions.solution: Q and N are immediate neighbors.

questions.text:
Study the following information: Seven friends A, B, C, D, E, F, G have exams on different days of the week starting from Monday to Sunday. A has exam on Wednesday. Only two people have exams between A and D. C has exam immediately before B. E has exam on Friday. G has exam after F.

On which day does F have the exam?
questions.solution: Arrangement: Mon-C, Tue-B, Wed-A, Thu-F, Fri-E, Sat-D, Sun-G. F has exam on Thursday.

questions.text: Based on the schedule in Q16: Who has the exam on Sunday?
questions.solution: G has the exam on Sunday.

questions.text: Based on the schedule in Q16: How many people have exams between B and E?
questions.solution: B is Tue, E is Fri. Between them are A and F. Two people.

questions.text: Based on the schedule in Q16: Who has the exam immediately before D?
questions.solution: D is on Saturday. E is on Friday. So E is immediately before D.

questions.text: Based on the schedule in Q16: Which of the following statements is FALSE?
options: B has exam immediately after C
questions.solution: D has exam on Saturday, not Sunday. So this statement is false.
